Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> Just now, Murdabenne said:
> 
> 
> Famous last words :-)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I'm loading it now.
> 

It's only a parts pack, no code.

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, linuxgurugamer said:
> 
> 
> It's only a parts pack, no code.
> 

Like many here (yourself included) I go back to the end of 0.25 and started really playing with 0.90, so I've heard those kind of things said before.  Been there done than, and have the holes burned into my t-shirts to prove it.

KSP has taught me that Hopeful statements are Kraken bait. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

(*but in all seriousness, you're right*).
I still run SpaceY and SpaceY expanded, no problems other than one part which had to be updated for the new <abbr title="Reaction Control System">rcs</abbr>.
Does this mod need the Firespitter Core plugin? <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> lists it in dependencies.

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Krzeszny said:
> 
> 
> Does this mod need the Firespitter Core plugin? <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> lists it in dependencies.
> 

Doesnt look like it? Its not mentioned in the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>... I poked a few cfgs, and didnt see any patches or modules for Firespitter... vOv  

Quick way to check, if you have \*this\* installed, but not FS, is to scan your KSP.log for [ERROR] or [Warning].  

If any of the LETech parts require FS, but FS is not installed, there will be messages in the log saying that module FS"something or other" couldnt be found

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, Stone Blue said:
> 
> 
> Doesnt look like it
> 

In this case, who should I contact to remove that dependency in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>? The Firespitter Plugin isn't even compatible with latest KSP, so I can't install this mod.

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, Krzeszny said:
> 
> 
> In this case, who should I contact to remove that dependency in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>? The Firespitter Plugin isn't even compatible with latest KSP, so I can't install this mod.
> 

2nd to last post in FS thread, by RoverDude himself, says <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> data for FS is updated, and FS \*is\* compatable with 1.9.1  

If you are seeing issues with that, then the proper place to post would be the FS or <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> thread.  

As to whether \*this\* mod has a true dependency or not on FS, you are correct in posting here.  

I guess either the dev ( [@NecroBones](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105424-necrobones/) ), or someone who uses/and or really knows the workings of this mod, would have to reply. Necrobones hasnt been on in a longwhile, so I wouldnt really \*expect\* an answer from them any time Soon™ ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

> 
> 
> 12 minutes ago, Stone Blue said:
> 
> 
> 2nd to last post in FS thread, by RoverDude himself, says <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> data for FS is updated, and FS \*is\* compatable with 1.9.1
> 

No, RoverDude says it's compatible only with 1.8 and that <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> is right about that. "1st" last post says it's incompatible with 1.9.

Anyway, all we can do now is wait for <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>'s author to update LET's data... or to explain why that dependency shows up.

**Edited <time datetime="2020-04-07T15:14:16Z" title="04/07/2020 03:14  PM" data-short="4 yr">April 7, 2020</time> by Krzeszny**
  
back to topic

> 
> 
> 52 minutes ago, Krzeszny said:
> 
> 
> No, RoverDude says it's compatible only with 1.8 and that <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> is right about that. "1st" last post says it's incompatible with 1.9.
> 

Not to argue semantics, but RD posted that on Feb 29th... 3 days after 1.9.1 dropped  

Last post is just someone asking for a 1.9.1 update... has NOTHING saying its incompatable... they are probably just \*assuming\* it doesnt work because RD is too lazy to create a new thread and keep the thread title updated.

> 
> 
> 54 minutes ago, Krzeszny said:
> 
> 
> Anyway, all we can do now is wait for <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>'s author to update LET's data... or to explain why that dependency shows up.
> 

Well, if \*someone\* can confirm LET works in 1.9.1 (doesnt necessarily \*have\* to be the mod dev), the NETKAN file can be updated by the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> team. Unless a dev specifically states they dont want their mod listed on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> at all, or that \*they\*, only want to be the ones updating the NETKAN file, just about anyone can submit an update for it. vOv
Did all the cumulative updates to shaders etc, break this going in to 1.9.1 or 1.10.1?  I havent seen an issue yet, but I have only just loaded, not seriously vigorously tested this yet.
I've been using it in a 1.9.1 game (just the lander can, capsule, landing legs and ladders so far) with no issues thus far.
Trying this in 1.11.1

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, Murdabenne said:
> 
> 
> Trying this in 1.11.1
> 

How'd it go?

I have a hard Fatal Error - Exit to Desktop problem upon starting the game during <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> processing. Its not related to this mod, but its stopped me.  B9Partswitch throws the error and puts up a popup about it during the game startup screen, and all you can do is close the game (exit directly to desktop).  So I'm at a stop right now until that gets resolved.

[@blowfish](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/119688-blowfish/)figured it all out.  It wasn't B9Partswitch, but an oddity in configuration and dependencies in a different mod that caused B9 to error out.  I'll post here in a few days
Hi.   Does the Lithobrake mod work in KSP 1.11.2?   This was one of my "must have" mods!
Never mind, I decided to take a chance and it works great!   ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

How about 1.12.2?

I  really want to, just waiting for word from [@NecroBones](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105424-necrobones/).

Hello everyone! Sorry for my extremely long absence. I've moved on to a variety of other things, and as I'm sure you've noticed, I'm not maintaining these mods anymore. Zer0Kerbal has requested taking over maintenance of my mods, and so I've added him to the list of authors on Spacedock and Curseforge, so that these can continue to be updated to work on current versions of KSP. Thank you everyone for all of the love and support over the years. All of this has changed my life in ways I can't begin to describe, and has been some of the best online experience I've had to date. So I'm quite glad that others are willing to pick up the mantle and allow these mods to continue to be used. 

Thanks everyone!

[@HebaruSan](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/156657-hebarusan/)[@DasSkelett](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/188118-dasskelett/)

> 
>

> 
>

Thank you everyone for all of the love and support over the years. All of this has changed my life in ways I can't begin to describe, and has been some of the best online experience I've had to date. So I'm quite glad that others are willing to pick up the mantle and allow these mods to continue to be used.
